summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to UMB Bank, NA, dated June 15, 2020, demanding extensive financial records related to a specific account number from January 1, 2005, onward. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and related offenses, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Signed the subpoena and is the point of contact for the production of records; name is not fully specified in the document.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Scheduled date for UMB Bank to appear before the grand jury at the United States Courthouse in New York, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: Date the grand jury subpoena was issued to UMB Bank, NA, demanding financial records.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
UMB Bank, NA, 1010 Grand Boulevard, Kansas City, MO 64106
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
keyFacts: The subpoena targets a specific bank account number, seeking all related records from January 1, 2005, to the present, indicating a long-term financial investigation.

The investigation involves suspected violations of federal criminal laws including sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. § 1591), sex trafficking conspiracy (§ 1594(c)), coercion and enticement (§ 2422(b)), transportation with intent to engage in criminal sexual activity (§ 2423(a)), and conspiracy (§ 371).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests UMB Bank not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing grand jury investigation.

The subpoena demands an exceptionally broad range of financial records, including KYC documents, account statements, wire transfers, canceled checks, loan files, currency transaction reports, internal memoranda, and all correspondence related to the account.
The document is dated June 15, 2020, showing federal investigative activity related to the Epstein case was ongoing at that time, nearly a year after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
